unittitle.altrender: Papers on the Federal Reserve System,

did.unittitle: George Leslie Harrison Papers on the Federal Reserve System,

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lawyer, financial expers. Harrison was legal secretary to Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes, 1913-1914; Assistant General Counsel, and the Counsel, Federal Reserve Board, Washington, D.C., 1914-1920; Counsel and Deputy Governor, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, 1920-1928; Governor and President of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, 1928-1941; President, New York Life Insurance Company, 1941-1948; and Chairman of the Board, New York Life Insurance Company, 1948-1953. His career also included activities for the American Red Cross and trusteeship of Columbia University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers on banking and finance, especially relating to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 4 series:

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.corpname: Federal Reserve Bank of New York.
controlaccess.subject: Federal Reserve banks.
Banks and banking--United States.
Banks and banking--New York (State)
Finance--United States.
Insurance companies.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is located off-site. You will need to request this material at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); George Leslie Harrison Papers on the Federal Reserve System; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

Research to be published which is based upon or which employs quotations from material in the Harrison Papers must be submitted to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York for review prior to publication as of January 1968.

did.unittitle: Series I: Binders
Subseries I.1: S.P. Gilbert

S. P. Gilbert Incoming and outgoing cables between Gilbert ((Agent Gen., Reparations Payment) and various FRBNY officers, including Jay, Burgess, McGarrah, and Harrison. Many are marked "Strictly Confidential". Subjects: Reparations, B.I.S., Bank of England; dealings with J.P. Morgan and Gov. Norman, March 1926 - May1930
Subseries I.2: Bank for International Settlements

Bank for International Settlements Cables; B.I.S. (mostly signed Fraser) to FRBNY; FRBNY to B.I.S.. Very few marked confidential. Subjects: B.I.S. organization and transactions; Many cables from FRBNY to B.I.S. are regular review of money market, 2 April 1930 - December 1931
Subseries I.3: Reichsbank (Germany)

Reichsbank (Germany) Cables: Reichsbank to FRBNY. Marked "Confidential to Governor". Many signed by Schacht. Subjects: Transactions for accounts of Reichsbank; FRBNY series of cables on money market, 6 September 1925 - December 1930
Subseries I.4: Bank of England

Bank of England Incoming and outgoing cables between Bank of England and FRBNY; many marked "Strictly Confidential for Governor"; many Bank of England signed Norman and FRBNY signed Strong. Subjects: Wide range, but mostly transactions of Bank of England with FRBNY, U .S. commercial banks, or other foreign central banks, 1922 - 1924
Subseries I.5: Bank of France

Bank of France Incoming and outgoing cables between Banque de France and FRBNY; some Banque de France are marked "Confidential for Governor" and signed Moreau, Quesnay, or Rist; FRBNY signed Strong or Harrison. Subjects: Mostly Banque de France account transactions with FRBNY, U.S. commercial banks and other foreign central banks, October 1926 - March 1929
Subseries I.6: European Trips

European Trips (B. Strong; P. Jay; J. E. Crane; G. L. Harrison): -- Incoming and outgoing cables; many marked "Confidential for Governor". Subjects: Business in connection with visits to foreign central banks; many cables between Governor Norman and Governor Strong concerning the condition of various European central banks, particularly the Netherlands Bank, 1926
Subseries I.7: Officers and Others
Officers and Others: Federal Reserve Bank officers while abroad. [See list of names for Binder 34], 1933 - 1935
Subseries I.8: Personal Cables

Personal Cables: Incoming and outgoing between McGarrah and Fraser at B. I. S. and Harrison; marked "Personal Harrison". Subjects: European financial and monetary situation, B.I .S., reparations, Young Plan, 1930 .- 1935
Subseries I.9: Miscellaneous Cables

Miscellaneous Cables: Incoming and outgoing cables between 31 separate central banks (arranged alphabetically by name of bank) and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY , 1925 - 1932
Subseries I.10: Banca D'Italia
Banca d'Italia Incoming and outgoing cables between this bank and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY, 1925 - 1932
Subseries I.11: De Nederlandsche Bank
De Nederlandsche Bank Incoming and outgoing cables between this bank and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY, 1925 - 1932
Subseries I.12: Swiss National Bank
Swiss National Bank Incoming and outgoing cables between this bank and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY, 1927 - 1932
Subseries I.13: Banca D'Italia
Banca d'Italia Incoming and outgoing cables between this bank and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY, 1933 - 1938
Subseries I.14: De Nederlandsche Bank
De Nederlandsche Bank Incoming and outgoing cables between this bank and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY , 1933 - 1938
Subseries I.15: Swiss National Bank
Swiss National Bank Incoming and outgoing cables between this bank and FRBNY; some marked "Confidential". Subject: Account transactions with FRBNY , 1933 - 1938
Subseries I.16: Conversations

Conversations: Volume I: Memos from Gov. Harrison to Confidential Files, recording telephone conversations with foreign central bankers, particularly Gov. Norman and Sir Ernest Harvey. Also Treasury officials in Washington, and others. Records of conversations with foreign central bankers while Harrison was overseas. Subjects: Wide range, but mostly concerning FRBMY bank business, including open market operations, and foreign central bank business, including Bank of England credit, 1926 - 1931
Subseries I.17: Discussion Notes

Discussion Notes: Volumes I, II, & III -- Memoranda recording oral discussions concerning meeting of the FRBNY Board of Directors and the Executive Committee. Subjects: Credit policy, discount rates, purchase of Government securities, April 17, 1930 - September 21, 1933
Subseries I.17: Discussion Notes

Discussion Notes: Volumes I, II, & III -- Memoranda recording oral discussions concerning meeting of the FRBNY Board of Directors and the Executive Committee. Subjects: Credit policy, discount rates, purchase of Government securities, April 17, 1930 - September 21, 1933
Subseries I.18: Miscellaneous Letters and Reports

Miscellaneous Letters and Reports: Volume I -- Governor Harrison's copies of his bank correspondence, letters to Federal Reserve Board of Governors o Subjects: Mostly credit policy, discount rate, business conditions, 1920 - 1931
Subseries I.19: Office Memoranda

Office Memoranda: Volume I -- Inter office memoranda between Harrison and Strong, Sproul, Burgess, etc. Also contains more memos to Confidential Files, recording telephone and verbal conversations, 1921 - 1927
Subseries I.20: Special Memoranda

Special Memoranda: Volume I -- Forty-two studies that seem to be multilithed copies of special memoranda written by FRBNY officers. Most are unsigned, but some are by Burgess, Roelse, Williams. Examples: "Notes on mechanism of market for treasury bills" by Burgess (1937); "Public spending as means to recovery" by Williams (1936), 1933 - 1938
Subseries I.21: Supplemants to the Special Memoranda
Supplements to the Special Memoranda (Indexed in Binders: 65 & 66): -- Section I: "Organization of the Federal Reserve System"
Subseries I.22: Governors' Conference

Governors Conference: Volume I -- Includes Index to Minutes, mimeographed record of meetings and decisions; from 19314 to 19140 includes the Secretary's minutes, marked "Confidential"; Volume IV includes the President's Conference, 1921 - 1926
Subseries I.23: Federal Open Market Committee

scopecontent.p: Minutes (multilithed) of the Executive Committee of FOMC. Some marked "Preliminary draft", some "Revised draft."

did.unittitle: Volume I: Open Market Investment Committee, 1926 - 1930
Subseries I.24: Banking Studies

scopecontent.p: This multilithed set of spiral note books might be a pre liminary draft of the Board Banking Studies (published in 1914)

did.unittitle: Vo1ume I
Series II. Files
Answers to Questionnaire: No 7. Eligibility and Acceptability of Papers , 25 February 1931
Series III: Books
Books from the library of George Leslie Harrison - Inscribed and others
Series IV: Index
"An Index to Correspondence and Memoranda in the George L. Harrison Papers"
